subject: Re: ANN: "Unit Testing in Java" available
msgSnippet: ... is ... Tools ... recommedations ? I have just read Extreme Programming Explained by Kent Beck which was an inspiring read and have used junit and jfunc a
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Ilja Preuss" <preuss@d...> wrote:
> Chip Dunning wrote:
> > Actually I bought and read through it and it is not a very good
> > book. Actually let me qualify that. It is not a good book unless
> > you are heavily into EJB. It angles itself towards EJB using
> > several different tools; however in each case you just get started
> > and it jumps topics. So in that sense it is an intro book - just a
> > bit too much intro and not enough meat (using the word mastering
is
> > just a cruel joke).
> >
> > A more correct title would have been "EJB using XP and Open Source
> > Tools".
> >
> > A very disappointing book.
>
> Just wanted to make clear that you seem to be talking about "Java
Tools
> for Extreme Programming" here, not about the book in the subject?!
> I am looking for a book like "introduction to unit testing" any
recommedations ? I have just read "Extreme Programming Explained" by
Kent Beck which was an inspiring read and have used junit and jfunc a
bit but need more guidance - if you know what I mean.
> Ilja
